answers.answer: If you have been increasing your workouts and looking to increase your weight, then you are going to be more hungry as your body uses more energy(food). You are also at a point where you may be hitting a growth spurt, so your body would again need more food. Don't withhold food from your body if you feel hungry. Just make sure to eat healthy foods and you should be fine.

question: im 16 years old, male, 133 lbs, 5 foot 9 inches. last year i was 160 lbs, managed to lose alot of weight. i now lift 3-4 times a week, try to stay as active as i can, and eat pretty good (healthier than pretty much any other teen i know).never touched drugs or alcohol in my life.ok so theres the basic, now the problem is for the past week or so, i have been nothing but hungry.i honestly will eat a large meal, and an hour later i have hunger pangs. i thought maybe diabetes, but the only other symptom i have of that is frequent urination, but thats because i try to drink 10-12 cups of water a day to stay as hydrated as possible. i know im growing, but why all of a sudden has this hit me? i mostly eat whole grain carbs, a ton of protein, fiber, and drink nothing but water soymilk and tea every now and then. i should also mention in my weight training i have been trying to increase my weight and workload each time, trying to get bigger and stronger. any suggestions as to what's up with me right now?any help is appreciated
title: 16 year old male, constantly hungry?
